page.title: 07LIVESTOCK AND MACHINERY
page.content: Four out of the five farms surveyed kept a total of 247{BEEF CATTLE.}These are fattened for market in Dundee. One farm kept 50 breeding cows. The largest farm kept 580{SHEEP}(240 ewes and 340 lambs). The sheep are grazed on upland pastures on the Sidlaw Hills in summer and wintered on the farm. A few farms with fodder to spare keep sheep only in winter. The sheep are kept for both{MUTTON}and{WOOL.} Horses and farm labourers have now been replaced by machines. Four-furrow ploughs speed ploughing and combine harvesters and grain driers shorten harvest time. Potatoes are sown and harvested by machine. The potato harvester has a stone separator. Silage is also collected and maintained by machine. One farmer remarked 'a good mechanic is now more valuable than a horse on the farm'.
